meanings.definition: The quality of being childishly sulky or bad-tempered.
meanings.sent1: Her constant petulance made it hard to enjoy family outings.
meanings.sent2: His petulance was evident when he refused to share his toys.
meanings.sent3: Despite her petulance, she always brightened up when offered ice cream.
meanings.sent4: The petulance in her voice was like a dark cloud hanging over the room.
meanings.sent5: The teacher addressed the petulance in the classroom by introducing fun activities.

meanings.definition: An example of being childishly sulky or bad-tempered.
meanings.sent1: The petulance child refused to join the group activity.
meanings.sent2: She gave a petulance look when asked to clean up her room.
meanings.sent3: His petulance behavior turned into laughter when tickled.
meanings.sent4: The petulance expression on his face softened as he received a compliment.
meanings.sent5: The petulance attitude of the cat was evident when it refused to be petted.
